Package com.hush.pgp

Interface Summary
PgpConstants Constants used extensively are declared and defined in this interface.
 

Class Summary
AlgorithmFactory This class contains static methods that accept constant integers and return algorithm implementations.
CanonicalSignedMessage This class creates or verifies a cleartext signed message.
CommandLinePgp This classes allows various command line operations to be performed.
Features A holder for a feature information as described in RFC 2440 5.2.3.24.
Key An object representing a PGP key.
Key.KeyType Enum like class used to describe the key type
KeyFlags A holder for key flags as described in RFC 2440 5.2.3.21.
KeyGenerator This class generates a complete set of PGP keys.
Keyring An object representing a PGP key ring, with the implementation to either read or write it's contents from or to a stream.
KeyServerPreferences A holder for key server preferences information as described in RFC 2440 5.2.3.17.
MPI Class MPI representing a 'Multi Precision Integer' (MPI) as specified in rfc2440.
NotationData A holder for notation data information as described in RFC 2440 5.2.3.16.
PgpUtils Some common PGP related tasks.
RevocationKeySpecifier A holder for revocation key information as described in RFC 2440 5.2.3.15.
RevocationReason A holder for a reason for revocation as described in RFC 2440 5.2.3.23.
S2kAlgorithm A S2kAlgorithm is an algorithm that converts a string (passphrase) to a symmetric encryption key.
Signable An abstract class to group objects that have signatures associated with them.
Signature A class to create and verify PGP signatures.
SignatureSubpacket Implements a signature subpacket as described in RFC 2440 5.2.3.1.
SignatureTarget Identifies the signature targeted by another signature as described in RFC 2440 5.2.3.25.
UserAttribute A class that encapsulates a PGP user Attribute.
UserID A class that encapsulates a PGP user ID.
 

Exception Summary
DataFormatException This is a subclass of IOException intended to be thrown from a read method of an InputStream when the is a problem interpreting the format of the data being read.
InvalidSignatureException Indicates that an attempt to verify a signature with a particular key failed.
MissingSelfSignatureException This exception is thrown if a self-signature on a key or certification is missing.
SignatureExpiredException This exception is thrown on an attempt to verify a signature for a time outside of the validity period for the signature.
